docs.text:
Welcome to 
Vytics


Introduction


Vytics is an analytics platform that helps you and your organization discover better insights faster, thus making better decision on time.


Main Features




Query, graph, and do statistical analysis in a 
Connection
.


Organize and manage data and report in a 
Project
.


Data
 - Query, join/merge, manage data from multiple connections.


Report
 - Visualize data and organize plots in predefined layouts.








A Quick Look






(1) 
New Connection
 and 
New Project
 buttons to create a new connection or a new project.


(2) 
Settings
 and 
Help
 buttons to configure, activate, and get help about Vytics.


(3) 
Connection
 pane that lists all connections


(4) 
Project
 pane that lists recent projects (e.g., 
Home Energy
 project)


(5) Recent reports in the project


(6) A switch to list recent projects or all projects.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Vytics is an analytics platform that helps you and your organization discover better insights faster, thus making better decision on time.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Query, graph, and do statistical analysis in a  Connection .  Organize and manage data and report in a  Project .  Data  - Query, join/merge, manage data from multiple connections.  Report  - Visualize data and organize plots in predefined layouts.
docs.title: Main Features

docs.text: (1)  New Connection  and  New Project  buttons to create a new connection or a new project.  (2)  Settings  and  Help  buttons to configure, activate, and get help about Vytics.  (3)  Connection  pane that lists all connections  (4)  Project  pane that lists recent projects (e.g.,  Home Energy  project)  (5) Recent reports in the project  (6) A switch to list recent projects or all projects.
docs.title: A Quick Look

docs.text:
Installation


Run the installation executable file you downloaded from our webiste and follow the steps below to install Vytics Desktop.






Go to Vytics download page and download suitable Vytics version. 






Run the download file. 






Windows may block you from running it. Select 
More info
. 






Click on 
Run anyway
 to continue. 






On the Setup Wizard, Click 
Next
 to continue. 






Read the 
License Agreement
 carefully. If you agree with the agreement, click 
Next
 to continue. 






Click 
Browse
 and select where you want to install Vytics. Click 
Next
 to continue. 






Confirm installation. Click 
Next
 to continue. 






Windows asks for permission to continue with the installation. Click 
Next
 to continue. 






By default, Vytics will start after the installation. If you do not want to start Vytics, uncheck 
Launch Vytics
. Click 
Close
 to complete the installation.
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: Run the installation executable file you downloaded from our webiste and follow the steps below to install Vytics Desktop.    Go to Vytics download page and download suitable Vytics version.     Run the download file.     Windows may block you from running it. Select  More info .     Click on  Run anyway  to continue.     On the Setup Wizard, Click  Next  to continue.     Read the  License Agreement  carefully. If you agree with the agreement, click  Next  to continue.     Click  Browse  and select where you want to install Vytics. Click  Next  to continue.     Confirm installation. Click  Next  to continue.     Windows asks for permission to continue with the installation. Click  Next  to continue.     By default, Vytics will start after the installation. If you do not want to start Vytics, uncheck  Launch Vytics . Click  Close  to complete the installation.
docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
Activation


Trial Request


The trial version of Vytics Desktop is free and works for 2 weeks. After that, you will have to purchase a paid version to continue using Vytics.






The first time Vytics Desktop starts, you will see the window below. To request for trial version:




Check 
I have not bought Vytics yet (Trial License)
 to request for trial version


Enter your information




Click 
Submit Request
 to send your request. 






You will receive trial key immediately if your request is valid. Click 
OK
 to start using Vytics Desktop. 










Paid Activation Request


If you have already purchased Vytics Desktop:




Uncheck 
I have not bought Vytics yet (Trial License)
 if you have purchased Vytics Desktop.


Enter your information and 
Transaction ID
 and click 
Submit Request
. You will receive a temporary key immediately and we will send the activation key to you via the email you provided.






Enter Paid Activation Key






Upon receiving your activation key in the email you provided during request process, go to 
Settings
 -> 
Application Activation
 to open activation window. 






Copy and paste your activation key to the 
License Information
 and click 
Activate
. 






If your license key is valid, Vytics will be activated immediately. Click 
OK
 to complete your activation process.
docs.title: Activation

docs.text: The trial version of Vytics Desktop is free and works for 2 weeks. After that, you will have to purchase a paid version to continue using Vytics.    The first time Vytics Desktop starts, you will see the window below. To request for trial version:   Check  I have not bought Vytics yet (Trial License)  to request for trial version  Enter your information   Click  Submit Request  to send your request.     You will receive trial key immediately if your request is valid. Click  OK  to start using Vytics Desktop.
docs.title: Trial Request

docs.text: If you have already purchased Vytics Desktop:   Uncheck  I have not bought Vytics yet (Trial License)  if you have purchased Vytics Desktop.  Enter your information and  Transaction ID  and click  Submit Request . You will receive a temporary key immediately and we will send the activation key to you via the email you provided.
docs.title: Paid Activation Request

docs.text: Upon receiving your activation key in the email you provided during request process, go to  Settings  ->  Application Activation  to open activation window.     Copy and paste your activation key to the  License Information  and click  Activate .     If your license key is valid, Vytics will be activated immediately. Click  OK  to complete your activation process.
docs.title: Enter Paid Activation Key

docs.text:
Create new Connection


This section describes how to create a new text connection. Creating other connection types is similar.


Create New Text Connection






Click 
New Connection
 button on the top left corner to create a new connection.






Install text driver if you do not have it (skip to step 9 if you already had one). Click 
Download and Install
 to install the required driver. 






The progress bar will show the download progress. Once the download completes, the installation will run automatically. 






Click 
Yes
 to accept the driver installation. 






Click 
Next
 to continue. ![Welcome Wizard]](/img/connection/new_conn/new_con5.png)






Read the license agreement carefully and check accept box. Click 
Next
 to continue. 






Select install location and click 
Install
. 






Click 
OK
 to continue. 






Enter 
Connection Name
 and click 
Browse
. 






Select a text file and click 
Open
. 






The preview panel will show the content of your text file. Click 
Save
 to save connection. Click 
Define Custom Format
 if what you see in the preview is not what you expect. 






The newly created connection will show on the 
Connection
 section of the Home tab page. 






Create New Excel Connection




Create a new Excel connection is very similar to creating a text connection. Enter 
Connection Name
 and click 
Browse
 to browse to the file location. 




Create New SQLite Connection




Enter 
Connection Name
 and click 
Browse
 to browse to the file location. Enter 
Password
 if your datatbase file is password-protected. 




Create New PostgreSQL Connection






Enter 
Connection Name
 and the PostgreSQL server information. Click 
Advanced
 for more options. 






Enter 
Initial Database
 if you want to set a default database when open the connection. Click 
Save
 to complete adding new connection. 






Create New MySQL Connection




Enter 
Connection Name
 and the PostgreSQL server information. Click 
Save
 to complete adding new connection. 




Create New Microsoft SQLServer Connection






Enter 
Connection Name
 and the SQLServer server information. Vytics supports both 
Windows Authentication
 and 
Server Authentication
. Click 
Advanced
 for more options. 






Enter 
Initial Database
 if you want to set a default database when open the connection. Click 
Save
 to complete adding new connection.
docs.title: Create new connection

docs.text: This section describes how to create a new text connection. Creating other connection types is similar.

Click  Yes  to accept the driver installation.     Click  Next  to continue. ![Welcome Wizard]](/img/connection/new_conn/new_con5.png)    Read the license agreement carefully and check accept box. Click  Next  to continue.     Select install location and click  Install .     Click  OK  to continue.     Enter  Connection Name  and click  Browse .     Select a text file and click  Open .     The preview panel will show the content of your text file. Click  Save  to save connection. Click  Define Custom Format  if what you see in the preview is not what you expect.     The newly created connection will show on the  Connection  section of the Home tab page.
docs.title: Create New Text Connection

docs.text: Create a new Excel connection is very similar to creating a text connection. Enter  Connection Name  and click  Browse  to browse to the file location.

docs.text: Enter  Connection Name  and click  Browse  to browse to the file location. Enter  Password  if your datatbase file is password-protected.
docs.title: Create New SQLite Connection

docs.text: Enter  Connection Name  and the PostgreSQL server information. Click  Advanced  for more options.     Enter  Initial Database  if you want to set a default database when open the connection. Click  Save  to complete adding new connection.

docs.text: Enter  Connection Name  and the PostgreSQL server information. Click  Save  to complete adding new connection.

Enter  Initial Database  if you want to set a default database when open the connection. Click  Save  to complete adding new connection.
docs.title: Create New Microsoft SQLServer Connection

docs.text:
Data Section


Open connection and query data


Vytics Desktop allows you to query all connections in SQL language. To query data from a connection, follow steps below.






Double left click to open a connection. If a connection is a text file, this will also query the data from the connection. 






The default query and queried data will be shown. 






You can modify the SQL query to fit your needs. Vytics offers auto-complete feature and context sensitive editor. 






After editting the SQL query, click 
Execute
 or press 
F5
 to run the query. The result will be updated in the data grid at the bottom. 






Add custom column


Before plotting any dataset, you should check for data types to prevent unexpected result. To add a custom column, follow steps below.






Open and query 
home_energy
 connection (file home_energy_consumption.csv). Click 
Columns Info
 to see columns information. 






Notice the 
Timestamp
 column has the data type of 
String
, which is not correct. There are 2 options to solve this issue: 1) change the SQL query to cast the 
Timestamp
 column to 
DateTime
 data type or 2) add a custom column. In this section, we will use approach (2). 






Right click anywhere on the data grid header and select 
Add Custom Field
. 






The 
Add Custom Field
 dialog will display. There is a 
Quick Help
 on the right hand side for your convenience. Start typing 
Timestamp
 in the left text area. 






At the bottom, select 
DateTime
 as return data type and enter 
Timestamp2
 as new field name. Click 
Add Field
 to complete. 






You will see new field 
Timestamp2
 added to your result. 






Export data


Vytics allows you to export data in 2 different formats. Each export format has multiple options that you can use (e.g., export all or just visible columns, with or without header, etc.)






Click 
CSV Export
 to export data to csv file. 






Select where you want to save the exported data and enter the file name. Click 
Save
 to write data to disk. 






Query history


Vytics saves all executed queries and group them by date. To retrieve past queries, follow steps below:






Click 
Open Query History
. 






Query history dialog will open. A list of dates is displayed on the left and all queries that are executed on the selected date are displayed in the text area on the right hand side.
docs.title: Data section

docs.text: Vytics Desktop allows you to query all connections in SQL language. To query data from a connection, follow steps below.    Double left click to open a connection. If a connection is a text file, this will also query the data from the connection.     The default query and queried data will be shown.     You can modify the SQL query to fit your needs. Vytics offers auto-complete feature and context sensitive editor.     After editting the SQL query, click  Execute  or press  F5  to run the query. The result will be updated in the data grid at the bottom.
docs.title: Open connection and query data

docs.text: Before plotting any dataset, you should check for data types to prevent unexpected result. To add a custom column, follow steps below.    Open and query  home_energy  connection (file home_energy_consumption.csv). Click  Columns Info  to see columns information.     Notice the  Timestamp  column has the data type of  String , which is not correct. There are 2 options to solve this issue: 1) change the SQL query to cast the  Timestamp  column to  DateTime  data type or 2) add a custom column. In this section, we will use approach (2).     Right click anywhere on the data grid header and select  Add Custom Field .     The  Add Custom Field  dialog will display. There is a  Quick Help  on the right hand side for your convenience. Start typing  Timestamp  in the left text area.     At the bottom, select  DateTime  as return data type and enter  Timestamp2  as new field name. Click  Add Field  to complete.     You will see new field  Timestamp2  added to your result.
docs.title: Add custom column

Each export format has multiple options that you can use (e.g., export all or just visible columns, with or without header, etc.)    Click  CSV Export  to export data to csv file.     Select where you want to save the exported data and enter the file name. Click  Save  to write data to disk.
docs.title: Export data

docs.text: Vytics saves all executed queries and group them by date. To retrieve past queries, follow steps below:    Click  Open Query History .     Query history dialog will open. A list of dates is displayed on the left and all queries that are executed on the selected date are displayed in the text area on the right hand side.
docs.title: Query history

docs.text:
Graph Section


Plot data


Vytics Desktop allows you to plot your SQL query result quickly. To plot data, follow steps below.






Click on 
Graph
 button to switch to Graph view. Click on the 
minus sign
 to collapse the Connection Explorer pane. 






Drag and drop columns from the result treeview on the left to the variable boxes on the right. In this example, 
Timestamp
 is dragged into 
Independent Var
 box and 
GlobalActivePower_kW
 and 
GlobalReactivePower_kW
 are dragged into 
Dependent Vars1
 box. 






The plot will automatically display as you drag and drop columns to the variable boxes. 






You can also show/hide series by clicking on the series legend. In this picture, 
GlobalReactivePower_kW
 is hidden from the view. See more graph operations in the 
Project Report
 section. 






Filter/Smooth data


Vytics offers multiple ways to filter and smooth your data. To filter/smooth data, follow steps below.






Click 
Filtering
 and then 
Filtering top N values
 to start filtering process. 






Enter information as below and click 
Add Series
 to highlight 10 points having greatest values. 






A new series 
GlobalActivePower_kW_TopN
 is added to the plot. 






Click 
Smoothing
 and then 
Moving Average
 to start smoothing process. 






Enter information as below and click 
Add Series
. 






A new series 
GlobalActivePower_kW_MovingAverage
 is added to the plot. 






Click 
GlobalActivePower_kW
 and 
GlobalActivePower_kW_TopN
 to hide them. 






Export chart


To export your plot, follow steps below.






Click 
Export Chart
. 






Select where you want to save the exported plot and enter the file name. Click 
Save
.
docs.title: Graph section

docs.text: Vytics Desktop allows you to plot your SQL query result quickly. To plot data, follow steps below.    Click on  Graph  button to switch to Graph view. Click on the  minus sign  to collapse the Connection Explorer pane.     Drag and drop columns from the result treeview on the left to the variable boxes on the right. In this example,  Timestamp  is dragged into  Independent Var  box and  GlobalActivePower_kW  and  GlobalReactivePower_kW  are dragged into  Dependent Vars1  box.     The plot will automatically display as you drag and drop columns to the variable boxes.     You can also show/hide series by clicking on the series legend. In this picture,  GlobalReactivePower_kW  is hidden from the view. See more graph operations in the  Project Report  section.
docs.title: Plot data

docs.text: Vytics offers multiple ways to filter and smooth your data. To filter/smooth data, follow steps below.    Click  Filtering  and then  Filtering top N values  to start filtering process.     Enter information as below and click  Add Series  to highlight 10 points having greatest values.     A new series  GlobalActivePower_kW_TopN  is added to the plot.     Click  Smoothing  and then  Moving Average  to start smoothing process.     Enter information as below and click  Add Series .     A new series  GlobalActivePower_kW_MovingAverage  is added to the plot.     Click  GlobalActivePower_kW  and  GlobalActivePower_kW_TopN  to hide them.
docs.title: Filter/Smooth data

docs.text: To export your plot, follow steps below.    Click  Export Chart .     Select where you want to save the exported plot and enter the file name. Click  Save .
docs.title: Export chart

docs.text:
Statistics Section


Vytics Desktop offers some statistics functions. This is a new feature and we are gradually add more functions to it.






Open and query data from a connection. Click on 
Statistics
 button to switch to statistics view. In statistics view, click on 
Statistics
 and then 
Descriptive Statistics
. 






Select a variable in the drop-down and click 
Run
.  






The statistics will be displayed on the right pane.
docs.title: Statistics section

docs.text: Vytics Desktop offers some statistics functions. This is a new feature and we are gradually add more functions to it.    Open and query data from a connection. Click on  Statistics  button to switch to statistics view. In statistics view, click on  Statistics  and then  Descriptive Statistics .     Select a variable in the drop-down and click  Run .      The statistics will be displayed on the right pane.
docs.title: Statistics Section

docs.text:
Create New Project


Project is where you manage your data and reports. This section describes basic operations when working on a project.


Create Project






Click 
New Project
 button on the top left corner to create a new project. 






Enter 
Project Name
 and 
Project Description
. Click 
Save
 to complete. 






Project Home will automatically display. 






Delete Project






Click 
Delete Project
 icon to delete an existing project.






Click 
Yes
 to confirm. 






Open Existing Project






Click on project name 
Home Energy
 to open the project. 






The Project Home will display. There are few important items:




(1) 
New Data
 button to create a new Data


(2) 
New Report
 button to create a new Report


(3) Project treeview to display all data and reports


(4) Snapshots of recent reports.
docs.title: Create new project

docs.text: Project is where you manage your data and reports. This section describes basic operations when working on a project.
docs.title: Create New Project

docs.text: Click  New Project  button on the top left corner to create a new project.     Enter  Project Name  and  Project Description . Click  Save  to complete.     Project Home will automatically display.
docs.title: Create Project

docs.text: Click  Delete Project  icon to delete an existing project.    Click  Yes  to confirm.
docs.title: Delete Project

docs.text: Click on project name  Home Energy  to open the project.     The Project Home will display. There are few important items:   (1)  New Data  button to create a new Data  (2)  New Report  button to create a new Report  (3) Project treeview to display all data and reports  (4) Snapshots of recent reports.
docs.title: Open Existing Project

docs.text:
Project Data


A 
Data
 is a model where you specify how you structure or merge/join data either vertically or horizontally. You can create a 
Data
 from one or multiple connections.


Create new data


To create a new data, follow steps below.






Click on project name 
Home Energy
 to open the project. 






Click on 
New Data
 to create a new data. 






The 
New Data
 dialog will display. Select 
home_energy_consumption
 from the 
Connection
 drop-down. 






The 
Database
 and 
Table
 fields are auto-populated because the connection is text-based. Click on the triangle icon to push the data source to the model pane. 






The data for the 
home_energy_consumption
 will be displayed in the 
Data Preview
. 






Similarly, add 
weather_Sceaux_France
 to the data model. 






Click on the overlapped circles icon to select merge/join field. 






Vytics supports 4 types of merge/join. Default selection is 
Inner Join
. Click on the question mark icon the top right corner to get more details. Select left and right join fields from the drop-down. The 
Data Preview
 will auto update after the selection completes. 






Enter data name and data description and click 
Save
. 






The new data 
Energy with Weather
 is added. 






View/edit/rename/remove data


To view/edit/rename/remove data, right click on the data and select the option accordingly.
docs.title: Working with Data

docs.text: A  Data  is a model where you specify how you structure or merge/join data either vertically or horizontally. You can create a  Data  from one or multiple connections.
docs.title: Project Data

docs.text: To create a new data, follow steps below.    Click on project name  Home Energy  to open the project.     Click on  New Data  to create a new data.     The  New Data  dialog will display. Select  home_energy_consumption  from the  Connection  drop-down.     The  Database  and  Table  fields are auto-populated because the connection is text-based. Click on the triangle icon to push the data source to the model pane.     The data for the  home_energy_consumption  will be displayed in the  Data Preview .     Similarly, add  weather_Sceaux_France  to the data model.     Click on the overlapped circles icon to select merge/join field.     Vytics supports 4 types of merge/join. Default selection is  Inner Join . Click on the question mark icon the top right corner to get more details. Select left and right join fields from the drop-down. The  Data Preview  will auto update after the selection completes.     Enter data name and data description and click  Save .     The new data  Energy with Weather  is added.
docs.title: Create new data

docs.text: To view/edit/rename/remove data, right click on the data and select the option accordingly.
docs.title: View/edit/rename/remove data

docs.text:
Project Report


A 
Report
 is a set of plots and data that are organized in a certain order or layout. A report's data source can be a connection or a data.


Create new report


To create a new report, follow steps below.






Click on project name 
Home Energy
 to open the project. 






Click on 
New Report
 to create a new report. 






Enter report name and report description and click 
Save
. 






A new report view is displayed. Click add plot icon (bar chart with plus sign icon) to add a plot to the report. 






Select data source from the drop-down. A data source can be 
Connections
 or 
Project Data
. 






Drag and drop 
Timestamp
, 
GlobalActivePower_kW
, and 
temperature
 to variable text boxes to create a plot. 






A plot is created. Click 
Add Chart
 to add this plot to the report. 






The report now has a plot. Repeat the same steps to add a second plot. 






The report now has 2 plots. The first plot is 
GlobalActivePower_kW
 and 
temperature
 over time. The second plot is 
AC_WaterHeater_Wh
 and 
temperature
 over time. Right click on each of the plots and select 
Chart Settings
 






A report with 2 plots has been created successfully. You should be able to see its snapshot on the 
Project Home
. 






View/edit/rename/remove report


To view/edit/rename/remove report, right click on the report and select the option accordingly.
docs.title: Working with Report

docs.text: A  Report  is a set of plots and data that are organized in a certain order or layout. A report's data source can be a connection or a data.
docs.title: Project Report

docs.text: To create a new report, follow steps below.    Click on project name  Home Energy  to open the project.     Click on  New Report  to create a new report.     Enter report name and report description and click  Save .     A new report view is displayed. Click add plot icon (bar chart with plus sign icon) to add a plot to the report.     Select data source from the drop-down. A data source can be  Connections  or  Project Data .     Drag and drop  Timestamp ,  GlobalActivePower_kW , and  temperature  to variable text boxes to create a plot.     A plot is created. Click  Add Chart  to add this plot to the report.     The report now has a plot. Repeat the same steps to add a second plot.     The report now has 2 plots. The first plot is  GlobalActivePower_kW  and  temperature  over time. The second plot is  AC_WaterHeater_Wh  and  temperature  over time. Right click on each of the plots and select  Chart Settings      A report with 2 plots has been created successfully. You should be able to see its snapshot on the  Project Home .
docs.title: Create new report

docs.text: To view/edit/rename/remove report, right click on the report and select the option accordingly.
docs.title: View/edit/rename/remove report

docs.text:
Settings


Vytics allows you to do your own customization in many different ways. To customize Vytics, follow steps below.






Click on settings icon on the top right corner (wrench and hammer icon) and then select 
Application Settings
. 






The settings view will display. You will see settings groups on the left hand side and a list of settings corresponding to the selected group on the right hand side.
docs.title: Settings

docs.text: Vytics allows you to do your own customization in many different ways. To customize Vytics, follow steps below.    Click on settings icon on the top right corner (wrench and hammer icon) and then select  Application Settings .     The settings view will display. You will see settings groups on the left hand side and a list of settings corresponding to the selected group on the right hand side.
docs.title: Settings
